symptom_text: My father has chest pain and sweating heavily
first_aid: Call emergency services immediately. Keep the person calm and seated. Give aspirin if not allergic. Begin CPR if unconscious.

symptom_text: Feeling tightness in chest with nausea
first_aid: Call emergency services. Keep calm and seated. Give aspirin if not allergic. Begin CPR if unconscious.

symptom_text: Severe chest pain and shortness of breath
first_aid: Call emergency services immediately. Keep the person calm and seated. Give aspirin if not allergic. Begin CPR if unconscious.
Call emergency services. Keep the person calm and seated. Give aspirin if not allergic. Begin CPR if unconscious.
Call emergency services immediately. Keep calm. Begin CPR if unconscious.
Call emergency services immediately. Start CPR until help arrives.
Check airway and breathing. Start CPR. Call emergency services.
Call emergency services. Start CPR if not breathing. Keep airway clear.
Give 5 back blows and 5 abdominal thrusts. If the child becomes unconscious, start CPR and call emergency services.
Give back blows and abdominal thrusts. Start CPR if unresponsive. Call emergency services.
Perform Heimlich maneuver. If unconscious, start CPR and call emergency services.
Give 5 back blows and 5 abdominal thrusts. Start CPR if unresponsive.
Perform Heimlich maneuver. If unresponsive, start CPR. Call emergency services.
Cool under running water for 20 minutes. Cover with sterile dressing. Do not apply butter or ice.
Cool with running water for 20 minutes. Cover with sterile dressing. Seek medical help.
Cool with running water. Cover with sterile dressing. Do not burst blisters.
Wash the cut with clean water. Apply antiseptic and bandage.
Clean with water. Apply antiseptic and bandage.

symptom_text: Child with minor cut on arm
first_aid: Wash with clean water. Apply antiseptic. Cover with bandage.
Check airway, breathing, and pulse. Place in recovery position. Call emergency services.
Lay flat. Raise legs. Check breathing. Call emergency services.
Check airway, breathing, pulse. Keep person lying down. Call emergency services.
Keep calm and still. Do not suck the venom. Get medical help immediately.
Keep the person calm. Immobilize affected limb. Seek medical help immediately.
Give antihistamines if available. Administer epinephrine if severe. Call emergency services.
Give antihistamines if available. Use epinephrine if severe. Call emergency services.
Move to a cool place. Give cool water. Apply wet cloths to lower body temperature.

symptom_text: Heat exhaustion with headache and dizziness
first_aid: Move to shade. Give water. Rest. Seek medical help if condition worsens.
Immobilize the area. Apply ice packs around injury. Seek medical help immediately.
Immobilize wrist. Apply ice packs. Seek medical help.
Apply direct pressure with a clean cloth. Keep the area elevated. Call emergency services.
Sit the person upright. Pinch nose. Lean forward. Call emergency services if bleeding continues.
Call Poison Control immediately. Do not induce vomiting unless instructed. Keep the person calm.
Call Poison Control. Do not induce vomiting. Keep calm. Seek medical help.
Ensure power source is off. Check breathing. Start CPR if needed. Call emergency services.
Lay the person flat, raise legs if possible. Check airway and breathing. Call emergency services.
Cool under running water. Apply sterile dressing. Do not put butter or ice.

first_aid: Call emergency services. Keep calm and seated. Begin CPR if unconscious.
Perform Heimlich maneuver. If unconscious, start CPR. Call emergency services.
Give 5 back blows and 5 abdominal thrusts. Start CPR if unresponsive. Call emergency services.
Move to cool place. Give fluids. Apply wet cloths. Seek medical help.
Lay flat. Raise legs. Check breathing. Call emergency services.
Immobilize the area. Keep still. Apply ice packs. Seek medical help.
Apply direct pressure. Keep elevated. Call emergency services.

first_aid: Wash with clean water. Apply antiseptic and bandage.
